Class Node

  • java.lang.Object
    • Node
  • public class Node
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a node in the planetary system hierarchy. A node can be of type Star, Planet, or Moon, and may contain child nodes.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Node​(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String type, SensorData sensorData)
      Constructs a Node with a given name, type, and sensor data.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      Adds a child node to this node.
      java.util.List<Node> getChildren()
      Gets the list of child nodes of this node.
      java.lang.String getName()
      Gets the name of this node.
      SensorData getSensorData()
      Gets the sensor data associated with this node.
      java.lang.String getType()
      Gets the type of this node.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Node

        public Node​(java.lang.String name,
            java.lang.String type,
            SensorData sensorData)
        Constructs a Node with a given name, type, and sensor data.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the celestial body
        type - the type of the celestial body ("Star", "Planet", or "Moon")
        sensorData - the sensor data associated with this node

        Adds a child node to this node.
        Parameters:

        Gets the name of this node.

        public java.lang.String getType()
        Gets the type of this node.

      • getSensorData

        public SensorData getSensorData()

      • getChildren

        public java.util.List<Node> getChildren()
        Gets the list of child nodes of this node.
        Returns:
        a list of children (e.g. planets or moons)
